channel.title: KDE Display Manager doesnt start! (enough RAM)
channel.description:
Hello,
I am for a very long time a happy Whonix User. I was using Whonix Gateway 9 until today with VMWare Workstation 11 and some custom VMs as Workstations. (Host System is Windows 7 x64) Everything was always working fine.
However, now I wanted to change to Whonix Gateway 11, but unfortunately its not working properly. Although I have enough RAM assigned to the VM (1GB), the KDE Display Manager doesnt start!
The Whonix Gateway itself in console mode seems working! Lets say first: Its only the KDM that doesnt work or start somehow...
That last two lines (starting with "[INFO]") were just showing for a half second. As I remember from Whonix 9 there should be actually some more load time. However, it says it would start KDM, but it doesnt really. [URL=http://www.pic-upload.de/view-28098919/1.png.html][IMG]http://www11.pic-upload.de/thumb/23.08.15/61fwp9wonop.png[/img][/URL]
Thats the next what was showing to me. (That "host login:"-line seems also to be unusual, because there is no line break...?) [URL=http://www.pic-upload.de/view-28098932/2.png.html][IMG]http://www11.pic-upload.de/thumb/23.08.15/wucf9z6g63pn.png[/img][/URL]
Can you please tell me how to fix this KDM Problem?
Is there a way to start KDM manually from the console?
Would be awesome if you could help me with this Problem :(
Btw, this Project is f*cking awesome! Keep it up!

item.title: KDE Display Manager doesnt start! (enough RAM)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
VMware (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VMware) is unsupported. (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#What_do_you_mean_by_unsupported.3F)

I don’t think this problem is caused by rads (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Desktop#RAM_Adjusted_Desktop_Starter) or too less RAM.

Log into to a virtual console (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Desktop#Virtual_Consoles). Try manually starting it.

Will probably not work. Maybe this is caused by some incompatibility since Whonix 10 (Debian 7 wheezy based) to Whonix 11 (Debian 8 jessie based).

Check out xorg log. Try also if Debian jessie / KDE works in VMware.

Read full topic
item.source: KDE Display Manager doesnt start! (enough RAM)

item.title: KDE Display Manager doesnt start! (enough RAM)
item.dc:creator: WinterIsComing
item.description:
Hello,

I am for a very long time a happy Whonix User.
I was using Whonix Gateway 9 until today with VMWare Workstation 11 and some custom VMs as Workstations. (Host System is Windows 7 x64)
Everything was always working fine.

However, now I wanted to change to Whonix Gateway 11, but unfortunately its not working properly.
Although I have enough RAM assigned to the VM (1GB), the KDE Display Manager doesnt start!

The Whonix Gateway itself in console mode seems working! Lets say first: Its only the KDM that doesnt work or start somehow…

That last two lines (starting with “[INFO]”) were just showing for a half second. As I remember from Whonix 9 there should be actually some more load time.
However, it says it would start KDM, but it doesnt really.
[URL=http://www.pic-upload.de/view-28098919/1.png.html][/URL]

Thats the next what was showing to me. (That “host login:”-line seems also to be unusual, because there is no line break…?)
[URL=http://www.pic-upload.de/view-28098932/2.png.html][/URL]

Can you please tell me how to fix this KDM Problem?

Is there a way to start KDM manually from the console?

Would be awesome if you could help me with this Problem

Btw, this Project is f*cking awesome! Keep it up!

Read full topic
item.source: KDE Display Manager doesnt start! (enough RAM)
